context_of_use: This use case allows managers to review and approve or reject orders within the business workflow.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
description: Enable managers to review and approve or reject orders as part of the business workflow.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
postconditions: Selected orders are approved or rejected.
Order status is updated in the system.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system has a mechanism to display pending orders for approval.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve or reject orders.
The system shall update the order status based on manager's decision.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the criteria for order approval or rejection.
main_flow: 1. Manager reviews pending orders → System displays order details.
2. Manager selects an order to approve or reject → System updates the order status accordingly.
3. Manager confirms the approval or rejection → System notifies the manager of the successful update.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the order cannot be updated due to system error, then the system displays an error message and prompts the manager to try again.
